intro: Hedyotis buxifolia, commonly known as the boxleaf geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and garden geraniums. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a red calyx. Its leaves are ovate and have a leathery texture, resembling the foliage of boxwood. Hedyotis buxifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
